intro: Strephonema, commonly known as the glasswort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in saline or coastal environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. Strephonema species often have succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that store water, aiding in survival in arid or salty soils. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The genus includes both annual and perennial species, with some being used in traditional medicine or as ornamental plants.
